column5: Folks the Port Glasgow Derby is i full swing lots of action so far despite the high winds and crummy weather. Where else can you buy your whole boat in for $20 for a week long derby and catch limits of big walleye and Rainbow Trout? For rules and detials click the link.  http://skunked.ca/viewtopic.php?t=4968&start=0  Here are some fish taken on the Reel Nauti from the week before the derby.
Real nice eyes Nitro Man  Thanks for sharing Leechman

Thanks we have caught some hogs out of Port Glasgow the last 2 years, I make fishing tackle and test most of my new stuff there, it is a very quiet friendly port. This is the first year for the derby, it is meant to be a family fun event. We have boated no less than 19 30" walleye this summer the biggest was 38" and over 14 pounds. The walleye fishing on Lake Erie is awesome but in my opinion the bigger ones seem to hang around the central basin near Port Glasgow.  Here is some more Glasgow fish porn

Wind and weather panned this weekends results but many smaller fish were weighed in. Get out and enjoy some Lake Erie Sport Fishing at Port Glasgow for $20 for your whole crew, or you could win some great prizes or $$$!  Click here for day 1 and 2 results:  http://www.skunked.ca/viewforum.php?f=55
